summary: This is an email exchange between an FBI agent and an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach, discussing the stress of the Epstein case and logistical details for sending a letter to an address in Bogotá, Colombia, and another in Carrollton, Virginia. The sender expresses physical pain and anxiety linked to the case.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Recipient of an email from an FBI agent, involved in the Epstein case logistics, based in West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the potential cause of stress and physical pain (ulcer) mentioned by the email sender.

connections.description: The prosecutor is working on the Epstein case, as indicated by the stress and reference to 'an ulcer from Epstein'.

events.title: Email exchange on case logistics
events.description: Email discussion between an FBI agent and a prosecutor about sending a letter to an address in Bogotá, Colombia, and obtaining a letter for MI to an address in Carrollton, Virginia, amid expressed stress over the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The email sender expresses intense stress and physical pain ('pain in my gut', 'ulcer from Epstein') directly linked to working on the Epstein case.
The FBI's legat (legal attaché) has located a 'good address' for an individual identified as 'MI'.
A letter for MI is to be included with a 'lead to Bogota', indicating international investigative steps.
The correspondence highlights the emotional and physical toll the Epstein investigation was taking on law enforcement and legal personnel in July 2008.
